alert.note: Alert for Owens Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 14 at 11:39AM PST until February 16 at 4:00AM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...West downslope winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph possible overnight and Tuesday morning. Tuesday afternoon, northwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Owens Valley. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Primary impacts to Highway 395 will occur overnight with the westerly downslope winds off the Sierra Nevada with increased potential for overturned high-profile vehicles between Bishop and Olancha. Strong north winds and blowing dust expected Tuesday morning onward.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
